text:
Some updates:
- So thanks to the open artificial pancreas guys (by way of shashi) I’m investigating a Texas Instruments (TI) chip which is a microcontroller designed to do RFID frequencies (TI11XX series)
- quick spreadsheet calcs imply 27-45 years standby with rechargeable and 136-228 years non recharge
- in terms of lighting a single RGB LED for 10 seconds, this can be done 952 times with rechargeable, and 4764 times with non rechargeable
to be conservative, cut those numbers in half
WTF is the battery made of? there’s no static battery drain?
i cant remember the coin cell drain numbers but i recall something like 7% per month!
good call gents, didnt think about discharge rate, only total available power
